intro: Fraxinus obtusa, commonly known as the Japanese ash, is a deciduous tree native to East Asia. It typically grows to a height of 10–20 meters with a broad, spreading crown. The leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a serrated margin, turning yellow in autumn. Its small, greenish-yellow flowers appear in clusters and are followed by winged samaras. The bark is smooth and grayish-brown, becoming fissured with age.
